oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Model 1850 Colt Navy revolver presented to Col. George Dibrell with authentication paper
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: .36 caliber Colt Navy revolver, serial number 103239. Inscription on the backstrap reads, "Presented to Colonel George G. Dibrell, 8th Tenn. Cav. by friends and citizens of Sparta, Tenn." The top flat of the barrel is marked, "ADDRESS COL. SAML COLT NEW YORK U.S. AMERICA." The gun was purchased by the White County Heritage Museum. Dibrell's (aka the 13th Tenn. Cav. Regt.) was part of Forrest's command and composed largely of White County men. It operated near Sparta and at Battle of Parker's Crossroads.
